issue.title: webloyalty ad on sncf-connect.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

ublock

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.sncf-connect.com/app/confirmation (after payment)

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard French filter, EasyList, Liste FR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. "webloyalty" ad shown in the payment confirmation page, known to be a scam presented in the form of an offer (https://www.journaldunet.com/ebusiness/commerce/1146478-webloyalty-bon-plan-pour-les-marchands-piege-pour-les-clients/)

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Screenshot 2022-12-31 at 00-16-09 SNCF Connect - Confirmation du voyage](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/111613844/210117425-e47b7677-2c30-4d18-857f-24ef11ab0cd1.png)

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
>May I ask what is the use of DNS protection when I turn off the DNS filter?

When DNS protection is enabled and DNS filter is disabled, you can still set a different DNS server (some of DNS servers blocks ads, trackers, malware/phishing websites, some doesn't).
I have asked to disable DNS filter, just for test purpose, to know if issue is caused by blocked request(s) or maybe there is a different reason.

`DNS protection` and `AdGuard DNS filter` are two different options, you can disable `AdGuard DNS filter` and still have `DNS protection` option enabled.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
I tried many dns servers when DNS protection was enable, but all of them blocked data from the site. 
Continue receiving data from the site, First disable Adguard protection. 
Then I enable Adguard protection with DNS protection disable and the data from the site continues to be received.
As a result, DNS protection have to disable in order to receive data from the site. (Disable DNS filters is not enough)

comment.body:
You may try this rule to access shadow-root (for products which support $replace), cannot test atm:

`cdn.opencmp.net/tcf-v2/platforms/modern/ui.js$replace=/mode\:\"closed\"/mode\:\"open\"/`

But for products without $replace function I do not see a way unless you rebuilt ui.js via javascript and delete site's elements.

Rules to unlock cookie dialogue (other two requests are only shown to me when first is unblocked):
```
@@||cdn.opencmp.net/*/cmp-stub-latest.js$domain=kreiszeitung.de
@@||cdn.opencmp.net/*/platforms^
@@||cdn.opencmp.net/publisher/dvl/
```
